result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 22CF30, 22CF68, 22CF81, 22CF112, and 22CF126.  22CF30 here for STC.  22CF68 and 22CF81 arraignment.  22CF112 Initial appearance not sure if completed.  22CF126 initial appearance, def does not have a copy of compliant just filed this morning, attorney not on case.  Attorney, 22CF112 has not talked to def regarding, waive time limits in preliminary hearing.  2CF68 and 22CF81 received information and waives reading, pleas NG, entered.  Defendant Michael T Campbell appeared by video. Appointing Mr. Gross in 22CF126, asking for cases to track, need to do AIA in 22CF126 and 22CF112, STC in remaining cases.  22CF126 court reviewed compliant, finds probable cause that a felony has been committed in Ashland county.  State comments on conditions for release, no abusive contact with victim M.L.C. and to follow all court orders.  Attorney comments.  Def can come to court, needs to sign by the end of business today.
